runs.comm: length ball on the stumps, tapped short to the leg side
pushed through outside off stump, Rossouw punches into a gap at cover for one
around the wicket, touch short and van Wyk rocks back to cut but misses out, hits the fielder
short and wide again, this time van Wyk gets a firmer connection, slaps it in front of the diving Sammy at point... although it wasn't a great effort to stop the ball

same delivery, same shot... but this time the ball comes high off the bat and flies straight to point! Sammy had switched with Pollard and van Wyke played the most accommodating of shots, he swipes at the floor in frustration before heading off
gives this a bit more air, outside the line of off stump, Faf leans out and watches it through
good line, around middle and off, comes forward and pushes a length ball  back down the track
Cottrell drops short, offers some width and Rossouw uppercuts him into the stands! He was off his feet, threw everything into that shot and it sailed beyond the rope
better length, leans out to drive and the ball squirts off the outer half of the bat, lands short of point
short again... and dispatched again! This time hammered over deep square leg, there was a man out there but Rossouw sent the ball soaring through the thin Jo'burg air and into the crow once more
goes full and straight this time, Rossouw is coming forwards, digs it out to mid-on and bellows "No!"

length ball, outside off, leans into a punchy square drive and Russell takes it on the shin, deflects the ball away and Sammy hares after it... the slide and throw is superb, nearly resulting in a mix-up between the batsmen but Rossouw makes his ground as Ramdin collects and throws into the stumps
length ball outside off, du Plessis pokes and misses - couldn't reach it and called wide
in the channel, slightly back of a length, swings hard and this time carves one on the up to third man

short and angled across, Rossouw aims another punishing blow to the leg side - and nicks off! This rose sharply off a length, the extra bounce did for the batsman, visible top edge and Rossouw immediately drags himself away. WI have a second
very full and wide... too wide
straighter line, worked off the hips to short midwicket
back of a length and pushed square on the off side
wristily done, du Plessis walks across his stumps and flicks this over backward square leg for four. He's been watching Roger Federer
slightly back of a length, du Plessis charges and flings a horizontal bat, a bottom edge deflects into the off side
back of a length, slightly wide in the channel, swing and a miss from du Plessis - called wide, though it looked tight
straighter line, good pace from Russell, 135kph and worked to the leg side
fired across the lefty's bows, climbing through off a length, Miller flails unsuccessfully at it

tighter to the stumps, this is a super stroke, all timing and the ball runs tantalisingly close to Pollard at point before burning him off on the way to the rope. Just a back-foot punch but it raced away
shortish and around off stump, angled bat from Miller and an inside edge runs square
length on middle and leg, neatly worked around the corner but short fine leg prevents it from running away
Russell digs this in, sharp bounce and du Plessis ducks underneath it
pushed across on off stump, Miller dabs one into the covers

length on the stumps, du Plessis again goes across and whips over square leg... that'll be four, despite the labouring efforts of substitute fielder Lendl Simmons. He got around the boundary but couldn't hold the ball, then fell over trying to chase after it, watched the ball trickle into the rope
low full toss as du Plessis advances, squeezed towards mid-on
short and at the body, Holder is below 130kph and this sits up to be thrashed through square leg on the pull
Holder tries the cutter, Miller makes room and swings this away to leg again... There's a man out there now but he won't cut it off at deep midwicket. Back-to-back boundaries
pitched up outside off now, rasping drive from Miller, straight to the fielder on the edge of the ring. Looked like that stung the hands from Gayle's reaction
around the wicket, angled in with the arm and du Plessis goes hard it it, clears cover running back with a looping drive
smashed, all the way! This was tossed up on the stumps and du Plessis got low and underneath it, launched the ball into the stands
shorter length, on the stumps and du Plessis mistimes a cut
this slips out of the hand, down the leg side and it only needs a tickle on it to steer the ball past short fine leg for four more
another full toss, du Plessis backs away and lands another boundary body blow, a muscular crunch over cover point
three in a row! Big Benn is being struck right around the clock, short delivery and du Plessis powerfully crumps four over midwicket
over the wicket, pitched up outside off, driven down the ground
rolls the fingers over it, du Plessis makes room to drive, gets a low inside edge that bounces through to the keeper
length on off stump, throws the hands at it again, hoicked into the leg side and long-on runs in to keep them to one
shortish, on the stumps, Miller tries to work the ball back but finds mid-on
fetch that! Miller has lost the ball! Pitched up outside off and Miller bazookas the ball waaaaaaaaaaaaaaayyyyyyyy back over long-on, beyond the tin roof of the stand and into the golf course
draws his length ball a touch, Miller can't bat on it but the ball rolls away off the pad
shortish, played back down the track
short of a length and at the body, nudged through square leg and it's not taken cleanly, there's a man coming in off the rope but Miller had already called two and makes it back
on the stumps, stays in the crease and works one more to leg
goes around the wicket, low full toss and it's battered over midwicket, du Plessis continuing his bottom-handed cavalry charge around the Bullring
flicks off the straight towards short fine leg, Miller has to dive to be sure of his ground
very full, on leg stump and Miller swats at it, Cottrell yelps out an appeal as the ball deflects away
full and slowish, basically a half-volley on off stump and Miller pumps this into the top tier, another huge blow. That would have sent Dorothy all the way back to Kansas!
goes around the wicket, full length again, slightly wider, Miller settles for punching through the covers
stays around the wicket, length ball on the stumps, whipped through the leg side
middle-and-leg line, pre-meditated scoop from du Plessis, shuffling to off, can't get it past short fine leg but the throw is poor
on the stumps, maybe a cutter from Sammy, nurdled to the leg side

got hold of him, du Plessis this time! Picked the slower ball and backed away to thrash if over the head of the man at long-off... seemed like it came off the toe of the bat but still had the distance
over the wicket, pushed through outside off and Miller attempts to reverse sweep, doesn't get anything on it despite Ramdin's enthusiastic appeal
angled on the stumps with the arm, pulled through midwicket and they get back for two
floated up outside off, Miller plants the front foot and mows this into the crowd on the grass banks! Such power from Miller, the ball went off the middle of the bat like a rocket
fired on leg stump, cramped for room and he nudges one through square
filth from Benn, short and begging to be taken for a long walk, du Plessis rocks back and carts it over deep midwicket to bring up his half-century from just 23 deliveries
on the stumps, better length and dabbed into the leg side, really hard running brings them back for two
low full toss a foot outside off, so well struck and just over the head of extra-cover
a lower full toss and squirts this out to deep cover

yorker, well dug out, they try a quick single, Russell follows through and aims a kick at the stumps, connects and has got the run out! Superb work from the bowler. The batsman was diving full length into his ground and the bat is over the line but in the air. The football practise in the warm-up pays dividends for the West Indies. Pace onto the ball, got the right boot out and a nice touch to kick the ball onto leg stump in time, much-needed breakthrough for the tourists
full just outside off, batsman across his stumps to run this back to the bowler
straighter line, clipped to midwicket
bumper, too high and a wide
full toss on leg stump, flicked down to long leg
length outside off, driven out to deep cover
full at the stumps, tried to be flicked leg side and misses, ball runs back to the bowler
pushes leg side this time, they take on Sammy at midwicket for a single and get home despite the direct hit at the bowler's end, Sammy was a little sluggish there
full again, touched to the bowler's right and they get another sharp single
cutter on off stump, turned out backward of square on the leg side
wider on the crease, another cutter, driven at outside off, thick inside edge wide of square leg

full on the stumps, clipped out to deep midwicket, they're struggling for the second and had Ramdin gathered the ball, du Plessis was well gone but he let the ball slip under his legs, very poor from the keeper
yorker but down leg
full again, this on the stumps, turned down to long leg
misses the length and a full toss is clipped almost for six over square leg
cutter on a length, turned straight to square leg but they take on the fielder, Gayle was just barreling

slapped back to the bowler who parries it, reckless running but again West Indies botch a run out, poor throw to the keeper's end, Ramdin reaching to his right but he still had time to gather and remove the bails but he dropped the ball - literally!
tries to whip this leg side and gets struck on the pad
low full toss on the leg stump and Ontong finally gets one away, whacking this over midwicket, stayed right back in the crease and picked it up really well
cutter well outside off, slapped all the way across to deep midwicket, would have been a wide outside off had he left it
back deep in the crease again, whacks a full ball right in the gap between long-on and deep midwicket, couldn't have placed it better

length ball, a wild swipe to leg, top edge loops up to short third man. Bravo shimmies in celebration, Ontong goes just as it looked as he'd found his touch. Total miscue, a heave to leg from a loose base and was perhaps unfortunate to get so much top edge on the stroke but it didn't deserve any luck and it was a very easy catch
full ball just outside off, driven steadily out to deep cover
cutter on a fourth-stump line, nudged wide of mid-off and they take a simple single
cutter, wide of off stump, left alone, too wide
tighter line, slightly shorter length, tapped down the ground off the back foot and they run hard for two before long-on can get in
length just outside off, pressed out to deep cover
pushed off the back foot from just outside off wide of long-on for an easy couple
fuller but another couple flicked into the leg side gap
slower ball a little further outside off, still slapped leg side, deep midwicket charges in but midfields and concedes the second, Pollard screams at his fielder
slower ball on a length just outside off, du Plessis waits for it and goes right across his stumps before scooping it over short long leg, great improvisation
full a foot outside off, driven only to long-on
tries another scoop, this from a fuller ball but again outside off, gets it over the keeper but too much bat and it falls short of the fine leg fence
goes again and this time nails it, more delicate touch this time, steering it perfectly over the head of short long leg, uses the pace ideally this time
waist-high full toss on the off stump, du Plessis almost jumps out of his skin but still manages to steer it backward of square, too high the delivery
fuller, wide outside off, driven to deep cover
backs to leg and cracks a length ball from the stumps wide enough of deep cover for a second, Faf into the 90s

gorgeous, full on the off stump, du Plessis shuffles away to leg a little and drives over extra-cover, the timing so good it carries all the way for six, brilliant, and only one ball shy than Richard Levi's record! Didn't seem that quick
full on the stumps, flicked through square leg and that's du Plessis' hundred! From just 46 balls. The second T20I hundred by a South African, quite an innings
full just outside off, rather dug out into the covers
full on the stumps, flicked out through midwicket and the 200 comes up, the fourth time South Africa have scored 200 in a T20 on this ground
low full toss just outside off, clipped wide of midwicket again and there's another couple available
cutter on the off stump, batsman backs away and cuts to mid-off, he's cramping up now
yorker right on line, flicked via the pad just backward of square leg
full toss on the stumps, totally mistimed out towards deep cover, good job he did mistimed it
yorker, well bowled, dug out back to the bowler
almost dives across his stumps to flick inside short long leg, incredible, ends up in a heap towards point!
yorker again, inside edge onto the pad runs into the covers
full and wide of off stump, a big swipe aimed at this, missed
full length just outside off, tried to be smashed leg side and missed completed again
goes for a bumper and bangs it in too short
full on the off stump, driven down to long-off
nice bowling, yorker length a foot wide of off stump, driven at and missed
gets this one away but only to long-off's left and just a single
around the wicket, low full toss on the leg stump, nudged down to long-on, du Plessis is annoyed with himself
very full again, right on line, turned off the stumps and well saved by square leg diving to his right
stays back in the crease, heaves leg side and clears the wide midwicket fence, highest T20 individual score now for South Africa

goes down the ground this time and doesn't nail it and taken by long-on. Finally miscues one but it's the third-highest international T20 score and been some innings, clean ball striking, brilliant batting. Finally got one wrong and holed out to the deep fielder
full just outside off, big swing taken at his first ball and Wiese has belted it for six down the ground!

tries to go down the ground again but this is nowhere near as clean a strike and picks out long-off. Fielder had to run in a distance to take the chance but Smith got in well in time to hold the chance, clunky strike from the batsman
slower ball just outside off, swiped at and gets a thick outside edge that lands just short of Ramdin diving forward
another slowie, this is dragged leg side straight to deep midwicket
length ball on the off stump, slapped over the bowler's head and they get two as long-off runs to his right

excellent yorker, missed, there's a cry for lbw to start with and then Ramdin throws down the stumps as they try a bye and effects the run-out. So West Indies save themselves a run right at the death and that's not too bad a final over all things considered
